OnStart vs. OnLoad:

OnStart runs once when the app launches, making it ideal for pre-loading critical data (e.g., user settings, reference tables) that is needed globally.

OnLoad fires every time a screen is loaded, leading to repeated data calls if used for non-screen-specific data. This redundancy slows down navigation.

Performance Gains:

Centralizing data calls in OnStart with Concurrent() allows parallel data fetching during app initialization, hiding latency behind the appâ€™s loading screen.
